Url.Abstract: Lead Source Detail View Every contact has a lead source, such as a magazine ad, trade show, and so on that generates sales leads. This dialog box displays the description, creation date, abbreviation, source date, type, and status of the lead source associated with the current contact.

Url.Title: Adding New Contact for Existing Account
Url.Abstract: Adding New Contact for Existing Account Use the Insert Contact/Account view to add a new contact anexisting account. The account boxes will be populated with the existing account's information and cannot be edited.

Url.Title: Adding New Contact and Account
Url.Abstract: Adding a New Contact and Account Use the Insert Contact/Account view to add a new contact and new account.

Url.Title: Associating Contacts
Url.Abstract: Contact Association Detail View Use associations to create relationships between contacts. Associations are listed on the Associations tab on the Contacts Detail view. More than one contact association might exist for a particular contact.

Url.Title: Duplicating a Contact
Url.Abstract: Duplicating a Contact You can duplicate a contact for another account. This is useful if a contact joins another company and you want to associate the contact with both accounts. If you want to associate the contact with only the new account you can move the contact to that account.

Url.Title: Contact Details Tab
Url.Abstract: Contact Details Tab The Details Tab appears in the Contact Detail view. This tab contains specific information about the contact, such as the local time and time zone where the contact is located, who the contact was referred by, the department in which the contact works, the salutation, and the contact's assistant's name. You can edit the information at any time by clicking in a box and typing new information, or selecting from a list of available items.

Url.Title: Contact Detail View Web Access Tab
Url.Abstract: Contact Detail View Web Access Tab The Contact Detail Web Access tab is available to administrative users or users who have been given permission to grant access to contacts for Customer Portal. When contacts are granted access, they can log on to Customer Portal, view all tickets in their account, add new tickets, change ticket status, and close tickets. Customers can view or add information on tickets for their accounts only. Customers can view or add information on tickets for their accounts only.

Url.Title: Contact Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Contact Information Boxes The following table describes the default information boxes. Box Description

Url.Title: Copying Information to Clipboard
Url.Abstract: Copying Information to the Clipboard The information is copied to the Clipboard, so that you can use it in other applications. This is useful if you need to copy information into an e-mail, or Microsoft Word document.

Url.Title: Lead Sources Tab
Url.Abstract: Lead Sources Tab The Lead Sources tab appears in the Contact Detail view. Each time you add a new contact or opportunity, you can associate a lead source to indicate how your company found out about the contact or opportunity (trade shows, magazine ads, telesales, and so forth). Click a lead source to view detailed information about it. Columns on the tab include: date, description, and source code.

Url.Title: What Happens When I Move or Duplicate a Contact?
Url.Abstract: What Happens When I Move or Duplicate a Contact? You can move a contact or make a duplicate of a contact and attach it to another account.

Url.Title: New Contact Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Contact Information Boxes The contact information boxes contain in-depth information about the selected contact. You can add, edit or delete the information as needed.

Url.Title: Opportunities Tab - Contact Detail view
Url.Abstract: Opportunities Tab - Contact Detail view You can use the Opportunities tab of the Contact Detail view to see information about opportunities linked to the selected contact. You can also associate the contact with an opportunity.

Url.Title: Potential Matching Records
Url.Abstract: Potential Matching Records When adding a contact or account, you can compare the contact or account you are adding to contacts or accounts that exist in the database. If a record exists in the database with the same information, you can avoid having duplicate records. If you choose to use a matching account, the account information will be added to the account boxes in the Contact/Account Information dialog box. If the contact or account information does not match, you can continue adding your contact or account.

Url.Title: Setting a Primary Contact
Url.Abstract: Setting a Primary Contact A primary contact is the main contact for an account or opportunity. Typically, the primary contact is the person in an organization that you contact most often.

Url.Title: Processes Tab
Url.Abstract: Processes Tab The Processes tab appears in the Contact Detail view. Use the Processes tab to manage contact processes attached to a single contact.

Url.Title: Selecting an Address
Url.Abstract: Selecting an Alternate Address You can use the Select an Address dialog box to select an existing address for a new contact. The Select another Address button is available only if existing addresses are available. For example, if you are adding a contact to an account with multiple addresses, the account's addresses are available.

Url.Title: Copying a Contract
Url.Abstract: Copying a Contract You can copy information from an existing contract to create a new one. If you use the Copy button, Sage SalesLogix copies information from the original record.

Url.Title: Deleting a Contract
Url.Abstract: Deleting a Contract If you have the appropriate permissions, no tickets are associated with the contract, and the contract is not active, you can delete an unused contract for an account.

Url.Title: Editing a Contract
Url.Abstract: Editing a Contract Use the Contract Detail view to edit information for an active or inactive contract. To undo any changes, click Reset before clicking the Save button.

Url.Title: Contract Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Contract Information Boxes Your security access determines what functions are available. Contact your administrator for any access rights changes. WebViewer users may not access full functionality.

Url.Title: Contract Reference Number Duplicate
Url.Abstract: Contract Reference Number Duplicate Contract Reference Numbers must be unique. If a reference number already exists, the Contract Reference # Duplicate dialog box opens.

Url.Title: Contract Tickets Tab
Url.Abstract: Contract Tickets Tab The Tickets tab displays all tickets associated to the contract. This is a read-only view.

Url.Title: Contract Covered Assets Tab
Url.Abstract: Covered Assets Tab The Covered Assets tab displays information for each asset that is covered by the contract. You can use this tab to associate and disassociate assets covered by the contract.

Url.Title: Selecting a Contract
Url.Abstract: Selecting a Contract You can use the Select Contract view when the account has more than one service contract and you need to select the appropriate contract to charge the ticket against.

Url.Title: Promoting a Group to the Dashboard
Url.Abstract: Promoting a Group to the Dashboard Promoting a group to the Dashboard sends all the group data to a group list widget on the dashboard.

Url.Title: Defect Audit Trail Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Defect Audit Trail Tab The Defect Audit Trail tab contains a historical log of actions, such as changes made to fields on the Defect Detail view. The system automatically posts some of the information in the Audit Trail boxes on the tab; users cannot change that information. A customer service user or manager can use the Audit Trail tab to track and measure defect response time and effort.

Url.Title: Using the Comments Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Comments Tab Use this tab for all internal notes related to a defect or contract. To add Do one of the following:

Url.Title: Copying a Defect
Url.Abstract: Copying a Defect You can copy information from an existing defect to create a new one. If you use the Copy button, Sage SalesLogix copies information from the original record.

Url.Title: Deleting a Defect
Url.Abstract: Deleting a Defect If you have the appropriate privileges, you can delete a defect. To delete Open the Defect Detail view.

Url.Title: Defect Details Tab
Url.Abstract: Defect Details Tab The Details Tab appears in the Defect Detail view. This tab contains specific information about the defect.

Url.Title: Editing a Defect
Url.Abstract: Editing a Defect Use the Defect Detail view to edit information for an existing defect. For example, you can update the status, change the assignment to another person, or enter the details of how a defect was resolved.

Url.Title: Defect Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Defect Information Boxes The following table describes the default information boxes. Box Description/Action

Url.Title: Using the Defect Products Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Defect Products Tab This tab shows information for products this defect affects. Use this tab to add or remove an association between products and defects. Management and other users may use this information to determine the severity of the defect and actions needed to correct the defect.

Url.Title: Adding a Defect Resolution
Url.Abstract: Adding a Defect Resolution When you determine how a defect is going to be resolved, you need to add the information to the defect.

Url.Title: Defect Returns Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Defect Returns Tab Use this tab to add or remove an association between returns and defects. Management and other users may use this information to determine the severity of the defect and actions needed to correct the defect.

Url.Title: Changing the Status of a Defect
Url.Abstract: Changing the Status of a Defect When a defect is created, the status is set to Open. However, your organization may use other status types to indicate different stages in the defect resolution process. Consult your system administrator for more information on the status types your company uses.

Url.Title: Adding or Editing Defect Tasks
Url.Abstract: Adding or Editing Defect Tasks Use the Defect Task information boxes to add details for a new activity and to edit an existing activity.

Url.Title: Defect Tasks Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Defect Tasks Tab Use this tab to see all activities associated with the defect, to add or change time for working on a defect, or edit an activity. Activities can be any action involved in processing or resolving the defect. For example, if you need to research for the defect, add this activity here.

Url.Title: Defect Tickets Tab
Url.Abstract: Using the Defect Tickets Tab Use this tab to add or remove an association between tickets and defects. Management and other users may use this information to determine the severity of the defect and actions needed to correct the defect.

Url.Title: Tracking a Defect
Url.Abstract: Tracking a Defect Tracking a defect means you are working to resolve the defect. Use the following questions or refer to your company policies for the business rules for tracking defects in your organization.

Url.Title: Access Rights
Url.Abstract: Access Rights Access rights determine your ability to use features located on menus, toolbars and the Navigation Bar. Your access rights also determine the data you can access and are defined in the Administrator by the Sage SalesLogix system administrator.

Url.Title: Customizing Your List View Groups
Url.Abstract: Customizing Your List View Groups You can customize your list view tabs by adding or removing columns, changing the column order and adjusting the column widths. Sage SalesLogix will remember these changes each time you log in using the same browser and computer. You can also hide or show the list view check boxes.

Url.Title: Installing and Using Sage SalesLogix Desktop Integration
Url.Abstract: Installing and Using Sage SalesLogix Desktop Integration The Sage SalesLogix Desktop Integration Module is a collection of features to enhance your Sage SalesLogix Web experience.

Url.Title: E-mailing Contacts or Leads
Url.Abstract: E-mailing Contacts or Leads This function is only available if your e-mail program is compatible with your browser, and an e-mail address has been entered into the database for a contact or lead. If you enter an e-mail address for a contact or lead, update the record to enter the address in the database before attempting to send e-mail.

Url.Title: Exporting Records to a File
Url.Abstract: Exporting Records to a File You can export records to a file. The group column headings and formatting will also be exported.

Url.Title: Working with Grids in List Views and Tabs
Url.Abstract: Working with Grids in List Views and Tabs There are features that allow you to change the way information is displayed in a grid. You can use these features to sort records or to hide or rearrange columns in the grid.

Url.Title: Using a Memo Box
Url.Abstract: Using a Memo Box Use a memo box to add additional information, including notes, comments or a description.

Url.Title: Merging Records
Url.Abstract: Merging Records Use merge records to eliminate duplicates in your database. You can only merge duplicates to which you have access rights.

Url.Title: Working with the Navigation Bar Shortcut Menus
Url.Abstract: Working with the Navigation Bar Shortcut Menus The Navigation Bar shortcut menus enable you to open a list view, create a new record, or when applicable, create a new group. The shortcut menu options available vary depending on the record type.

Url.Title: Performing Process Tasks
Url.Abstract: Performing Process Tasks If you have configured process orchestration you can perform Process Tasks from the Common Tasks area in the Task Pane in some list views.

Url.Title: Unsaved Data Reminders
Url.Abstract: Unsaved Data Reminders When you update record information, an "*unsaved data" reminder appears in the Title Bar. If you have unsaved data and try to browse to another page, you will be prompted to save your changes. Click OK to save your changes or Cancel to remain on the page.

Url.Title: Sample Help Topic
Url.Abstract: Sample Help Topic This is a sample help topic. Replace the text in this topic with the instructions for using your custom view, then save the topic using the suggested naming convention.

Url.Title: Using the Summary View
Url.Abstract: Using the Summary View Use the Summary view to see commonly used information for each record type. The information and available features depend on the record type.

Url.Title: Using the Task Pane
Url.Abstract: Using the Task Pane The Task Pane consists of common tasks and features designed to help you complete your work. The available options depend on the record type and type of view where you are working.

Url.Title: Using Task Pane Filters
Url.Abstract: Using Task Pane Filters Use the Task Pane Filters to narrow the list of records that display in a list view group. The available filters are based on the columns in the selected list view and the information contained in those columns. Filters are saved on your computer until your browser cache is cleared.

Url.Title: Adding or Removing Filters
Url.Abstract: Adding or Removing Filters Filters allow you to narrow the list of records that display in a list view. The available filters are based on the columns in the selected list view and the information contained in those columns. However, you can customize the list of filters to only include the filters that you use for each group.

Url.Title: Adding or Removing Filter Items
Url.Abstract: Adding or Removing Filter Items Filters allow you to narrow the list of records that display in a list view. You can customize your filters to only include the filter items you want to use for each group.

Url.Title: Edit Name Information
Url.Abstract: Adding or Editing Name Information Use the Edit Name dialog box to add or edit name information.This ensures that a name includes a first and last name and that the name is stored correctly in the database. The templates and mail merge features require the correct name, title and suffix.

Url.Title: General Options
Url.Abstract: General Options Use the General tab to specify such settings as which view opens by default when you first log into Sage SalesLogix Web Client, and who to use as the default owner for any new records you create.

Url.Title: Understanding the Available Buttons
Url.Abstract: Understanding the Available Buttons Many features in the Sage SalesLogix Web Client are accessed through buttons. The following list shows each of the buttons available, and describes the action each button performs. When you drag your mouse across a button in the Sage SalesLogix Web Client, a tool tip explaining the button function appears. Buttons are referred to by their tool tip.

Url.Title: Adding or Removing Ad Hoc Group Records
Url.Abstract: Adding or Removing Ad Hoc Group Records You can manage your ad hoc groups by adding or removing records.

Url.Title: Copying a Group
Url.Abstract: Copying a Group You can select an existing group and copy it. You can maintain the existing conditions of the group or modify the conditions to suit your needs. You cannot copy ad hoc groups.

Url.Title: Setting a Default Group
Url.Abstract: Setting a Default Group You can set a default group for each list view. The default group is the group that will be open when you first go to the list view. The default group also determines the layout of new groups. There can only be one default group per list view.

Url.Title: Deleting Groups
Url.Abstract: Deleting Groups You can delete a group that you are no longer using. You can only delete groups you added. However, the system administrator can delete all groups.

Url.Title: Using the Group Shortcut Menu
Url.Abstract: Using the Group Shortcut Menu The groups shortcut menu enable you to create and manage groups. Not all menu options are available on all list views.

Url.Title: Group Manager
Url.Abstract: Group Manager Use the Groups list to view and manage all of your groups for a list or detail view. You can search, show hidden groups and hide groups. You can also add a new group.

Url.Title: Hiding Groups
Url.Abstract: Hiding Groups You can hide a group that you no longer want to view, but do not want to delete. To hide a group

Url.Title: Group Options
Url.Abstract: Group Options Use the Groups options tab to determine how your groups, list views and lookups will appear and behave. These options only apply when the current user is logged in to the Sage SalesLogix Web Client.

Url.Title: Sharing Groups with Other Users
Url.Abstract: Sharing Groups with Other Users You can share your groups with other Sage SalesLogix users, teams, or departments.

Url.Title: Showing Hidden Groups
Url.Abstract: Showing Hidden Groups You can show a group that has been hidden. To show a hidden group From the appropriate list view, click the Group menu.

Url.Title: Troubleshooting Accounting Integration - Information Does Not Sync
Url.Abstract: Troubleshooting Accounting Integration - Information Does Not Sync You may encounter the following issue when synchronizing information between Sage SalesLogix and supported accounting applications.

Url.Title: Troubleshooting Accounting Integration - Cannot Start the SalesLogix SData Sync Service
Url.Abstract: Troubleshooting Accounting Integration - Cannot Start the SalesLogix SData Sync Service SalesLogix You may encounter the following issues when synchronizing information between Sage SalesLogix and supported accounting applications.

Url.Title: Accounting Systems Tab
Url.Abstract: Accounting Systems Tab Use the Accounting Systems tab to manage the connections (feeds) to your accounting systems.

Url.Title: Accounting Tasks Pane
Url.Abstract: Accounting Tasks Pane This feature is only available if your administrator has configured Accounting Integration.

Url.Title: Account Detail View Accounting Details Tab
Url.Abstract: Account Detail View Accounting Details Tab (Accounting Integration Only) The Accounting Details tab displays additional company information from the accounting application. This information synchronizes to the linked account in the accounting system.

Url.Title: Accounting Sales Orders Tab
Url.Abstract: Accounting Sales Orders Tab (Accounting Integration Only) The Accounting Sales Orders tab in the Account Detail view displays the account's sales orders from the accounting system. You can use this tab to see information such as the order date, status, charges, and so on. This information is read-only.

Url.Title: Accounting Tab
Url.Abstract: Accounting Tab (Accounting Integration Only) The Accounting tab in the Account Detail view displays link information for accounting systems currently linked to Sage SalesLogix. You can use this tab to manage the links between systems. Only accounting systems configured on the Accounting Systems tab appear in the list. This view contains the following columns:

Url.Title: Running the Account Integration Phone and E-mail Update Utility
Url.Abstract: Running the Account Integration Phone and E-mail Update Utility Before setting up your Accounting Integration endpoints, you must run the Account Phone Number and E-mail record update utility. This utility creates a record in the ERPPHONENUMBER or ERPEMAILADDRESS table for each phone number and email column in either of the ACCOUNT or CONTACT tables. Those records are mapped back to the original entity column where they originated.

Url.Title: Invoices Tab
Url.Abstract: Invoices Tab (Accounting Integration Only) The Invoices tab in the Account Detail view displays the account's invoices from the accounting system. You can use this tab to see information such as the invoice status, balance, amount, and so on. This information is read-only.

Url.Title: Customer Payments Tab
Url.Abstract: Customer Payments Tab (Accounting Integration Only) The Customer Payments tab in the Account Detail view displays the payment status of the account's invoices. This information is read-only.

Url.Title: Creating a New Account from a Sales Order
Url.Abstract: Creating a New Account from a Sales Order You can create a sales order before you create an account or contact. If the prospect decides to do business with your company, you can create a new account and contact from the sales order with limited company and contact information.

Url.Title: Comparing and Configuring Schema Differences
Url.Abstract: Comparing and Configuring Schema Differences Sage recommends comparing the database schema in Sage SalesLogix with your accounting application schema to ensure data integrity. You can compare data for various resources to determine if differences in string lengths exist between systems.

Url.Title: Invoice Detail View
Url.Abstract: Invoice Detail View The Invoice Detail view displays read-only information from your accounting system.

Url.Title: Log Items Tab
Url.Abstract: Log Items Tab The Log Items tab displays the messages generated when a synchronization job is processed. Use the filters on this tab to define the logging information you want to view.

Url.Title: Matching Tab
Url.Abstract: Matching Tab Use the Matching tab to configure the options for finding matches between Sage SalesLogix and any integrated accounting systems. The options you select here define how the data entered by users in Sage SalesLogix will be matched to existing data in your accounting system. Tell me more...

Url.Title: Merge Contacts
Url.Abstract: Merge Contacts The Merge Contacts screen displays contacts for the Sage SalesLogix account you are linking to the customer you selected in the accounting system. Use this screen to create links and merge your Sage SalesLogix and accounting system contact records.

Url.Title: Merge Data
Url.Abstract: Merge Data The Merge Data screen displays differences in data when you are linking records between Sage SalesLogix and an accounting system. Use this screen to select the data you want to use when merging records. The data you keep overwrites the data in the other system. Tell me more...

Url.Title: Payment Detail View
Url.Abstract: Payment Detail View The Payment Detail view displays read-only information from your accounting system.

Url.Title: Sales Order Detail View (Accounting Integration)
Url.Abstract: Sales Order Detail View (Accounting Integration) (Accounting Integration Only) The Sales Order Detail view displays read-only information from your accounting system.

Url.Title: Search for Matches
Url.Abstract: Search for Matches The Search for Matches screen allows you to select the criteria to use when searching the accounting system for customers that are potential matches for the account you are linking from Sage SalesLogix.

Url.Title: Select an Accounting System
Url.Abstract: Select an Accounting System The Select an Accounting System screen in the Link to Accounting wizard displays the accounting systems available to link with the selected account.

Url.Title: Select or Create Account
Url.Abstract: Select or Create Account The Select or Create Account screen displays the customer(s) in the accounting system that are a potential match for the account you are linking in Sage SalesLogix. You can choose an existing customer to link, create a new customer record, or refine your search criteria and search again.

Url.Title: Set Up Accounting Integration
Url.Abstract: Set Up Accounting Integration Use the Set Up Accounting Integration dialog box to define the accounting feed details.

Url.Title: Synchronization Tab
Url.Abstract: Synchronization Tab Use the Synchronization tab to configure how often linked records synchronize between Sage SalesLogix and your accounting system.

Url.Title: Sync Results Detail View
Url.Abstract: Sync Results Detail View Use the Sync Results Detail view to see detailed information about a synchronization job item. Synchronization results display for jobs run between Sage SalesLogix and an integrated accounting system.

Url.Title: Sync Jobs List View
Url.Abstract: Sync Jobs List View The Sync Jobs List View displays information about synchronization jobs run between Sage SalesLogix and the accounting application.

Url.Title: Sync Job Detail View
Url.Abstract: Sync Job Detail View Use the Detail view to see, add, or edit information for a selected record. The Detail view consists of information boxes, tabs, and a user-defined middle section.

Url.Title: Sync Results List View
Url.Abstract: Sync Results List View The Sync Results List View displays information about synchronization cycles run between Sage SalesLogix and the accounting application. Only data related to the applying of records in the Sage SalesLogix or accounting system endpoint displays.

Url.Title: Adding a Contact to the SyncSalesLogix Group
Url.Abstract: Adding a Contact to the SyncSalesLogix Group You can add Sage SalesLogix contacts to the SyncSalesLogix group. By adding contacts to the SyncSalesLogix group any changes you make to the contacts are synchronized between Sage SalesLogix and Outlook or Lotus Notes the next time you run Intellisync.

Url.Title: Additional Help for Application Setup
Url.Abstract: Additional Help for Application Setup Additional information about configuring the following settings is available in the help topics available through the Intellisync for SalesLogix Advanced Setting Wizard.

Url.Title: Changing the Ad Hoc Contact Group
Url.Abstract: Changing the Ad Hoc Contact Group The first time each user configures Intellisync for SalesLogix, he or she must select SyncSalesLogix as your contact sync group. To change the contact sync group, you must first delete the group. You can then select a new group from the drop-down list in the Options screen.

Url.Title: Deleting Activities, Contacts, or Events
Url.Abstract: Deleting Activities, Contacts, or Events Intellisync for SalesLogix does not allow Outlook or Lotus Notes to delete activities, contacts, or events from the Sage SalesLogix database. You must delete these records manually after synchronizing.

Url.Title: Intellisync Connection URLS
Url.Abstract: Intellisync Connection URLs Before configuring Intellisync for SalesLogix, ensure you have the correct connection URL. The connection URL is the path to the Intellisync for SalesLogix portal. Each database requires it's own portal. Contact your Sage SalesLogix system administrator for the URL.

Url.Title: Intellisync Health Check
Url.Abstract: Intellisync Health Check Intellisync for SalesLogix includes a troubleshooting option called Intellisync Health Check. You can troubleshoot logging into the portal, and check the version of the assemblies. In most cases, checking the assembly versions is only done at the request of Sage Technical Support.

Url.Title: log file
Url.Abstract: To access the log file, right-click the Intellisync icon in the System Tray section of the Windows Taskbar, and select Show Push Sync Log.

Url.Title: Resolving Conflicts
Url.Abstract: Resolving Conflicts Conflicts are resolved at the record level. The following table lists the core fields used to determine conflict resolution:

Url.Title: Understanding Data Exchange
Url.Abstract: Understanding Data Exchange The following table lists types of data exchanged between Sage SalesLogix and Microsoft Outlook or Lotus Notes:

Url.Title: Understanding Factors Affecting Synchronization
Url.Abstract: Understanding Factors Affecting Synchronization The time it takes to synchronize data between Sage SalesLogix and Microsoft Outlook or Lotus Notes depends on several factors. The most important factor is the volume of data being passed between the systems. You can improve performance by controlling the volume of data transferred through Intellisync for SalesLogix. There are several ways to do this.

Url.Title: Understanding Intellisync for SalesLogix Field Mapping
Url.Abstract: Understanding Intellisync for SalesLogix Field Mapping Intellisync for SalesLogix works by moving data between connectors (or sometimes a connector and translator) and does not directly connect one database to another. For example, when you export data from Sage SalesLogix to Microsoft Outlook or Lotus Notes, Intellisync uses both the Sage SalesLogix and the Outlook or Lotus Notes connectors. The Sage SalesLogix connector reads the data in the Ad Hoc group you specified during configuration; the Outlook or Lotus Notes connector reads the data in the SyncSalesLogix category in Outlook or Lotus Notes.

Url.Title: Changing the Lead Owner
Url.Abstract: Updating Multiple Leads You can use the Update Multiple Leads dialog box to change the owner or account manager for multiple leads at once.

Url.Title: Converting Leads
Url.Abstract: Converting Leads Once lead information has been qualified, a lead can be converted to a contact and account. The Convert Lead dialog box displays any contacts or accounts with matching information. Leads with matching information can be merged with an existing contact, added to an existing account, or the lead can be added as a new contact and account. You can change the filter criteria used to find matching records.

Url.Title: Editing Leads
Url.Abstract: Editing a Lead Use the Lead Detail view to edit lead information. Lead Detail To edit On the Navigation Bar, click Leads.

Url.Title: Defining a Delimiter
Url.Abstract: Defining a Delimiter Use this view to select the appropriate delimiter value for your list and preview records before you import them to Sage SalesLogix. A delimiter parses fields in a list. Sage SalesLogix analyzes the list to determine which delimiter is currently used, but you can select a different delimiter if necessary.

Url.Title: Import Leads - Testing for Duplicate Records
Url.Abstract: Import Leads - Testing for Duplicate Records Use this view to preview the number of potential duplicates and errors before you import a list of leads. If you have a large number of potential duplicates, adjust your match filters so that only duplicate records are found.

Url.Title: Resolving Duplicate Leads
Url.Abstract: Resolving Duplicate Leads Found During Import When importing leads, you can look for other leads or contacts that exist in the database. Use this view to manually import or merge the duplicate records.

Url.Title: Lead Import Activity Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Lead Import Activity Information Boxes Use this view to add an activity to each imported lead. The full text of the activity, date and time appears in the Activities tabs for the Detail views.

Url.Title: Using Advanced Match Options
Url.Abstract: Using Advanced Match Options Use advanced match options to define how potential matches are found. To set advanced options

Url.Title: Managing Duplicate Records
Url.Abstract: Managing Duplicate Records When importing leads, you can look for other leads or contacts that exist in the database. If a record exists in the database with the same information, you can avoid having duplicate records.

Url.Title: Selecting a File to Import
Url.Abstract: Selecting a File to Import Use this view to select the file that contains the leads you want to import.

Url.Title: Selecting Import Group Actions
Url.Abstract: Selecting Import Group Actions Use this view to specify actions to be performed for the leads you import to Sage SalesLogix. You can add a note, add the record to a campaign, create a response or schedule an activity.

Url.Title: Lead Import History - Duplicates Tab
Url.Abstract: Lead Import History - Duplicates Tab Use this tab to view a list of records marked as a duplicates that must be resolved before it can be imported.

Url.Title: Lead Import History - History Tab
Url.Abstract: Lead Import History - History Tab Use this tab to view a list of records that encountered problems during the import. Records display in the tab if any of the following conditions occurred:

Url.Title: Using the Lead Import History List View
Url.Abstract: Using the Lead Import History List View Use the Import History List view to see a list of imported lead lists.

Url.Title: Mapping Import Fields
Url.Abstract: Mapping Import Fields Use this view to map fields in the import list to fields in Sage SalesLogix. You can save import information, such as matching fields, default lead owner and default lead source, and use it for future imports.

Url.Title: Adding an Import Group Action Note
Url.Abstract: Adding an Import Group Action Note Use this view to add a note to each imported lead. The full text of the note, date and time appear in the Notes tabs for the Detail views.

Url.Title: Processing the Import
Url.Abstract: Processing the Import Use this view to monitor the progress of the import. To cancel the import Before the import process completes, click Abort.

Url.Title: Adding an Import Group Action Response
Url.Abstract: Adding an Import Group Action Response Use this view to add a response to each imported lead. Responses keep track of interactions with a contact or lead. The response will appear on the Responses tabs in the Detail views.

Url.Title: Reviewing Import Selections
Url.Abstract: Reviewing Import Selections Use this view to review your selections before you import leads to Sage SalesLogix.

Url.Title: Adding an Import Group Action Campaign Target
Url.Abstract: Adding an Import Group Action Campaign Target Use this view to add each imported lead as a campaign target. Each lead will appear on the selected Campaign Detail view Targets tab.

Url.Title: Merging Duplicate Records
Url.Abstract: Merging Duplicate Records When converting a lead or resolving a duplicate import record you can merge the two duplicate records.

Url.Title: Rules for Automatically Merging Records During Import
Url.Abstract: Rules for Automatically Merging Records During Import During a lead import you have the option to automatically merge duplicate records that are found using the match filters you select. A duplicate lead may be merged with an existing contact or lead. The records are merged according to the following rules:

Url.Title: Lead Details Tab
Url.Abstract: Lead Details Tab The Details tab appears in the Lead Detail view. This tab contains specific information about the lead. You can edit the information at any time by clicking in a box and typing new information, or selecting from a list of available items.

Url.Title: Lead Information Boxes
Url.Abstract: Lead Information Boxes The following table describes the default information boxes. Box Description/Action

Url.Title: Looking for Matching Lead Records
Url.Abstract: Looking for Matching Lead Records When adding a lead, you can compare the lead to other leads, contacts or accounts that exist in the database. If a record exists in the database with the same information, you can avoid having duplicate records.

Url.Title: Saving an Import Template
Url.Abstract: Saving an Import Template You can save import information, such as matching fields, default lead owner and default lead source, and use it for future imports.

Url.Title: Adding, Renaming, or Deleting a Library Folder
Url.Abstract: Adding, Renaming, or Deleting a Library Folder For better organization, you can use Library folders to group documents together.

Url.Title: Library Document Properties
Url.Abstract: Library Document Properties Use the Document Properties dialog box to add to or change the properties of files in the Library. In addition to the editable fields, this dialog box provides the following read-only information:

Url.Title: Library
Url.Abstract: Working with the Library The Library is a central repository for company information (in the form of documents, URLs, and so on) that provides an easy way to distribute information to remote users. Files are organized into folders and sorted by name. Click the column headings to sort the library files list.

Url.Abstract: Adding a Literature Item The system administrator and users with the appropriate role can access these features.

Url.Title: Deleting Literature from the List
Url.Abstract: Deleting Literature from the List The system administrator and users with the appropriate role can access these features.

Url.Abstract: Literature Item Detail View The system administrator and users with the appropriate role can access these features.

Url.Title: Using the Literature Items List View
Url.Abstract: Using the Literature Items List View The system administrator and users with the appropriate role can access these features.

Url.Title: Literature Requests Tab
Url.Abstract: Literature Requests Tab The Literature Requests tab displays on the Account and Contact Detail Views, and lists all literature requests for the account or contact. The Literature Requests Tab contains the request date, send date, and what the request is regarding.

Url.Title: Scheduling a Literature Request
Url.Abstract: Scheduling a Literature Request You can schedule a literature request to have marketing materials or other documents sent to one or more contacts. After you schedule a request, the person or group at your company responsible for literature fulfillment can fulfill and complete the request.

Url.Title: Delete Literature Requests
Url.Abstract: Delete a Literature Request You can delete literature requests from the Activities view, or from the Literature Requests view.

Url.Title: Fulfilling, Completing or Rejecting Literature Requests
Url.Abstract: Fulfilling, Completing or Rejecting Literature Requests Use the Literature Request List view Common Tasks to fulfill, complete or reject literature requests.

Url.Title: Literature Request Detail View
Url.Abstract: Literature Request Detail View Use the Literature Request Detail view to see in-depth information about a specific order for literature to be sent to a contact. More than one literature request can exist for a particular contact. The Literature Request Detail view by default includes the names of the user who scheduled the request, the date by which it should be filled, a brief description, the contact and related account names, total cost, delivery method, priority, current status, fulfillment date, and user who fulfilled the request. Literature requests cannot be edited.

Url.Title: Managing Literature Requests
Url.Abstract: Managing Literature Requests Use the Literature Requests list view to view, fulfill, complete or reject literature requests.

Url.Title: Finding Records
Url.Abstract: Finding Records You can find a record by choosing criteria from a pick list and entering text. Your workspace may be different depending on your access rights or if your installation has been customized.

Url.Title: Using Lookup
Url.Abstract: Using Lookup The Lookup function allows you to choose criteria from a pick list and to enter text. You need a minimum of one search parameter for the query to display results. You can narrow your search by including more conditions.

Url.Title: Adding or Removing E-mail Attachments
Url.Abstract: About E-mail Attachments You can attach a file when sending an e-mail message to a contact or lead. If the correct options are selected, the file is stored on the Attachments tab for the Contact and Account or Lead, as well as in the default Documents folder. For Sage SalesLogix Web users, the file is stored in the Documents folder of the Web Server. On the Attachments tab, the file name is the exact name of the file or document. In the Documents folder, the file name includes an internal reference code assigned by Sage SalesLogix and the document name.

Url.Title: Attaching a Document to each Contact or Lead Critical Message
Url.Abstract: Attaching a Document to each Contact or Lead Critical Message For Sage SalesLogix Web users, this critical message is applicable if you are merging to a large number of contacts.

Url.Title: Editing Mail Merge Output Prior to Sending
Url.Abstract: Editing Mail Merge Output Prior to Sending You can edit the merged document for individual recipients prior to delivery. For example, you can add a personal greeting to a single letter. This option is found on the Merge Options tab for Mail Merge.

Url.Title: Most Recently Used Templates
Url.Abstract: Most Recently Used Templates You can use the most recently used templates list to select a recently used template without having to open the Select a Template dialog box. The number of recently used templates that appear in the list is set by you or your system administrator when configuring your Sage SalesLogix options.

Url.Title: Selecting the Type of Address
Url.Abstract: Selecting the Type of Address The Select Type of Address dialog box displays when performing a mail merge to a contact with more than one address or a group of contacts and using a template which contains any Sage SalesLogix merge fields from the address table.

Url.Title: Setting Follow-up Activity Date and Time
Url.Abstract: Setting Follow-up Activity Date and Time When using Sage SalesLogix Mail Merge, on the History Options tab, you can schedule a follow-up activity. The activity requires a date and you can specify a time and duration.

Url.Title: Setting History Options for Mail Merge
Url.Abstract: Setting History Options for Mail Merge The History Options tab lets you create a history item for the mail merge and schedule a follow-up activity.

Url.Title: Setting Merge Options for Mail Merge
Url.Abstract: Setting Merge Options for Mail Merge The Merge Options tab lets you set the merge options for Mail Merge.

Url.Title: Viewing Mail Merge Count Information
Url.Abstract: Viewing Mail Merge Count Information Use the Count button to view the possible merge results. The information provides a count and percentage for:

Url.Title: Match Options
Url.Abstract: Match Options Use the Match Options dialog box to set advanced filtering criteria for the Check for Duplicates wizard. Options set here apply each time you check for duplicate data.

Url.Title: Adding a Product Package
Url.Abstract: Adding a Product Package You can add packages to the packages list. This list is available when adding or editing opportunity or sales order products.

Url.Title: Deleting a Product Package
Url.Abstract: Deleting a Product Package You can delete product packages from the list that is available when adding or editing opportunity or sales order products and product packages.

Url.Title: Using the Package Detail View
Url.Abstract: Using the Package Detail View Use the Detail view to see, add, or edit information for a selected record. The Detail view consists of information boxes, tabs, and a user-defined middle section.

Url.Title: Editing a Product Package
Url.Abstract: Editing a Product Package Use the Package Detail view to edit package information. Package Detail To edit

Url.Title: Using the Packages List View
Url.Abstract: Using the Packages List View The Packages List view displays all of the packages that you have access to. You can use groups and lookups to narrow the list of records that display.

Url.Title: Package Products Tab
Url.Abstract: Package Products Tab Use this view to add, edit, or remove products associated with the package. How Do I?
